acceptStatus.description: The status of the VPC Peering Connection request.

accepter.description:
An optional configuration block that allows for [VPC Peering Connection](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/peering/what-is-vpc-peering.html) options to be set for the VPC that accepts
the peering connection (a maximum of one).

autoAccept.description: Accept the peering (both VPCs need to be in the same AWS account and region).

peerOwnerId.description:
The AWS account ID of the owner of the peer VPC.
Defaults to the account ID the AWS provider is currently connected to.

peerRegion.description:
The region of the accepter VPC of the VPC Peering Connection. `auto_accept` must be `false`,
and use the `aws.ec2.VpcPeeringConnectionAccepter` to manage the accepter side.

peerVpcId.description: The ID of the VPC with which you are creating the VPC Peering Connection.

requester.description:
A optional configuration block that allows for [VPC Peering Connection](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/peering/what-is-vpc-peering.html) options to be set for the VPC that requests
the peering connection (a maximum of one).

tags.description: A map of tags to assign to the resource. .If configured with a provider `default_tags` configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.

tagsAll.description: A map of tags assigned to the resource, including those inherited from the provider `default_tags` configuration block.

vpcId.description: The ID of the requester VPC.

accepter.description:
An optional configuration block that allows for [VPC Peering Connection](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/peering/what-is-vpc-peering.html) options to be set for the VPC that accepts
the peering connection (a maximum of one).
